titleStmt.title: A declaration and commission for the assesment of twelve thousand pounds by the month, for six months viz. from the twentie fourth of September 1656, exclusive : to the twenty fourth of March following, inclusive / by His Highness the Lord Protector's Council for the Affairs of Ireland.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

revisionDesc.change: 2014-05 SPi GlobalKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2014-07 Anne SimpsonText and markup reviewed and edited

div.head: ¶ By His Highness the Lord Protector's Council For the Affairs of IRELAND. ¶ A DECLARATION and COMMISSION for the Assesment of Twelve thousand Pounds by the Month, for Six Months; viz. From the twentie fourth of September 1656, exclusive: to the twenty fourth of March following, inclusive.
div.p:
WHereas by an Ordinance of his Highness the Lord Protector of the Common-wealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland, and the Dominions thereunto belonging, with the advice of his Council, bearing date the 23 day of Iune, 1654. Entituled, An Ordinance for the further encouragement of the Adventurers for Lands in Ireland, and of the Souldiers, and other Planters there. It is
Ordained (amongst other things) That for one year, commencing the twenty fourth day of Iune 1656, and ending the twenty fourth day of Iune 1657, there shall be Taxed, Assessed, and Leavied, upon all the Counties, Towns, and places in Ireland, and all the Estates real and personal therein, the sum of Twelve thousand pounds, for every month during that year. It is therefore hereby Ordered and Declared, That towards the pay of his Highness forces in Ireland, and other publick charges, there shall be Taxed, Assessed, and Leavied, upon all the Counties, Towns, and places in Ireland, and all the Estates real and personal therein, from the twenty fourth of September 1656 exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being Six months, after the rate of Twelve thousand pounds by the month, according to the sums hereafter named, by the several sums, and according to the several dates, and proportions hereafter expressed, viz. For the first Three Months Assesment, commencing the four and twentyeth of September next exclusive, and ending the twenty fourth day of December following inclusive,

Vpon the Countie of Dublin, the sum of One thousand four hundred and fourty pounds And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being the later three Months Assesment, the like Sum of one thousand, four hundred and forty pounds.

list.item: The City and County of the Citie of Dublin, the sum of nine hundred & sixty pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of nine hundred and sixty pounds.

The Countie of Kildare, the sum of eight hundred, and fourty pounds. And from and after the said twenty
fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of eight hundred, and forty pounds

The Countie of Catherlogh, the sum of two hundred twentie eight pounds. And from and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of two hundred, twentie eight pounds.

The Kings County, the sum of two hundred, seaventy and six pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of two hundred, seventy six pounds.

The Queens Countie, the sum of four hundred and fifteen pounds, our shillings. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of four hundred, and fifteen pounds, four shillings.

The County of Longford, the sum of one hundred thirty and two pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of one hundred thirty two pounds.

The Countie of East-Meath, the sum of three thousand two hundred and five pounds, four shillings. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of
three thousand, two hundred and five pounds, four shillings.

The County of West-Meath, the sum of six hundred eighty four pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of six hundred eighty and four pounds.

The Countie of Kilkenny and Citie, the sum of one thousand nine hundred and two pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of one thousand nine hundred and two pounds.

The County of Wexford, and the Town of Wexford, the sum of six hundred ninety six pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive; to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of six hundred ninety and six pounds.

The County of Wicklo, the sum of one hundred & twenty pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of one hundred and twenty pounds.

The County of Lowth, with the Town of Tredagh, the sum of nine hundred twenty one pounds, twelve shillings And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of nine hundred twenty one pounds, twelve shillings.

The Countie of Limerick, with the City and Countie thereof, the sum of one thousand one hundred fourty two pounds, eight shillings. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of one thousand, one hundred, and fortie two pounds, eight shillings.

The Countie of Corke, with the Citie and Countie thereof, the sum of four thousand nine hundred twenty nine pounds, twelve shillings. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of four thousand, nine hundred and twentie nine pounds, twelve shillings.

The Countie of Waterford, with the Citie and County thereof, the sum of one thousand, five hundred and sixty pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of one thousand, five hundred, and sixtie pounds.

The Countie of Clare, the sum of seaven hundred fourty and five pounds, four shillings. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following, inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of seven hundred, fortie five pounds, four shillings.

The Countie of Kerry, the sum of two hundred, and fourty pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of two hundred and fourtie pounds.

The Countie of Tipperary, including Holicross, the sum of two thousand two hundred and eighty pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of two thousand two hundred and eighty pounds.

The Countie of Donegal, the sum of one thousand four hundred eighty and eight pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being ther three Months the like sum of one thousand four hundred, eightie eight pounds.

The Countie of Tirone, the sum of six hundred pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of six hundred pounds.

The County of Fermanagh, the sum of three hundred and sixty pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of three hundred and sixty pounds.

The County of Cavan, the sum of two hundred and four pounds. And from and after the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of two hundred and four pounds.

The Countie of Monaghan, the sum of one hundred sixty and six pounds, sixteen shillings. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive,
being other three Months, the like sum of one hundred, sixty, and six pounds, sixteen shillings.

The Countie of Antrim and the Town of Carricfergus, the sum of two thousand, four hundred, and eighty four pounds And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of two thousand, four hundred, and eightie four pounds.

The Countie of Downe, the sum of two thousand, and eighty eight pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of two thousand, eightie and eight pounds.

The County of Ardmagh, the sum of four hundred, thirty and two pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of four hundred, thirtie, and two pounds.

The Countie of London-Derry, and the Citie, and County thereof, and the Town and Barony of Colerane, the sum of one thousand, three hundred and eighty pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of one thousand, three hundred and eightie pounds.

The Countie of Galloway, the sum of two thousand, five hundred, and twenty pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive,
being other three Months, the like sum of two thousand, five hundred, and twenty pounds.

The Countie of Roscomon, the sum of five hundred and sixty four pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of five hundred and sixty four pounds.

The Countie of Sligo, the sum of three hundred and sixty pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of three hundred, and sixtie pounds.

The Countie of Mayo, the sum of five hundred, and sixteen pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of five hundred, and sixteen pounds.

The Countie of Leitrim, the sum of one hundred and twenty pounds. And from, and after the said twentie fourth day of December exclusive, to the twentie fourth day of March following inclusive, being other three Months, the like sum of one hundred, and twentie pounds.

div.p: AND it is farther Ordered, That the several Commissioners of the respective Counties and places, nominated in an Order and Commission for the Assesment, bearing date the twenty eight of March last; as also those that are since appointed by Our Order in Writing, shall be and are hereby ordered to be Commissioners for the Assessing, Leavying, and Collecting the Assesments aforesaid.

And it is further ordered, and declared, that the Sherifs within each Countie respectively do forthwith upon receipt hereof appoint the time and place of meeting of the Commissioners within the respective Counties, and that the time of such meeting be within six days after the Receipt hereof by the said Sherifs, and in the chief Towns within each of the said Counties, or in some other Convenient place, in order to the timely and effectuall putting the said Commission in Execution.

And it is hereby ordered, and declared, that the said Assessment is to be Assessed, Raised, and Levyed for the times aforesaid, and to be taxed, and assessed by a pound Rate equally on the severall Devisions, Baronies, and Parishes in the respective Counties, Cities, and places aforesaid, for all, and every the Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments, Goods, Chattels, Moneys, Stock, and Estate, yeilding any profit or increase, according to the value thereof, (that is to say) as much upon every twenty shillings Rent, or yearly value of Land, and reall Estate; as upon Money, Stock, and other personall Estate, by an equall Rate; wherein, every five pounds in Money, Stock, or other personall Estate shall beare the like charge, as shall be laid upon every twenty shillings yearly Rent, or yearly value of Land, as will raise the monthly sum, or sums charged upon the respective Counties, or places aforesaid; And the said Commissioners, or any three, or more of them shall at their said first meeting, and after publick reading hereof) then, and there chuse, nominate, and appoint, two or three, (or more if they shall think fit) of the able and honest Protestant English Inhabitants (if it may be) in the several, and respective Baronies, Towns, Parishes, or Cities aforesaid; and them to appoint to take a particular and exact inquiry, survey, or estimate of each mans Lands, Tenements, Rent, and Stock, in every respective Citie, Town, Village, or Place; together with the yearly value, and Profits of the same: And to
Return the said inquiry, Survey, or Estimate under their hands in writing to the said Commissioners, or to such person or persons of them, as shall be by the said Commissioners appointed to receive the same.

And it is further ordered, that the severall Commissioners appointed for the respective Counties and Cities aforesaid, shall (in Assessing, Levying, and Collecting the Assessments aforesaid) observe the directions and instructions in the order and Commission for the Assessments, bearing date the first of Ianuary, 1654. and the respective powers and directions in the said order and Commission the aforesaid Commissioners or any three or more of them, are impowred to put in effectuall execution. Provided nevertheless, that if the way of a pound rate shall prove prejudiciall and obstructive to the bringing in of the respective Assessments hereby appointed or ordered, that then and in all such cases the major part of the said Commissioners in any of the Counties and Cities aforesaid, being met according to the summons given by the High Sherif in each Countie, shall be and are authorised to proceed accordingly to the most just and equall way of Rates held in such places in the apportioning, assessing, and levying the respective sums charged upon them. Provided also, that notwithstanding any former practice or directions, no Commissioners hereby named shall be forced to go out of the Countrey, for which they serve or are appointed, for the mannaging of the said severall Assessments. And to the end no impediment may be in the mannaging the work aforesaid, the said Commissioners, or any five or more of them, are hereby impowred, to chuse, nominate and appoint such ••• ing Clerk or Clerks, as shall be necessary for Transcribing the said Assessments, Certificates, or other Papers relating to the said Assessments.

And to the end the Forces (whose pay depends upon the said Assesments) may not be exposed or necessitated
to take Free-quarter from the Country; or other inconveniences be put upon the said Forces or Country: It is farther Ordered, That the aforesaid Assesment, after the rate of Twelve thousand pounds by the Month, for the first three Months, (commencing the twenty fourth of September 1656, exclusive, and ending the twenty fourth day of December following inclusive) be Levied, Collected and paid into the hands of the Receivers in the respective Counties, at or before the first day of October 1656; And that the Assesment of Twelve thousand pounds by the Month, (commencing the said twenty fourth day of December exclusive, and determining the twenty fourth day of March following inclusive) be likewise Levied, Collected and paid into the hands of the Receivers in the respective Counties aforementioned, at or before the first day of Ianuary next after the Date hereof.

And the Sherifs of the respective Counties for the time being, are hereby strictly required to take effectual care that the said several Assesments be Assessed and Levied in manner as aforesaid: For which purpose, they are hereby nominated and appointed to be Commissioners within their respective Bailifwicks.

And the said Commissioners nominated for the said Assesments, are also to cause the said Assesments, within their respective Counties and Divisions, to be fairly written and subscribed by them, and delivered to the respective Receivers within the said respective Counties. And it is farther Ordered, That the said Receivers do then forthwith after receipt thereof, send or cause to be sent unto the Clerk of the Council at Dublin, A true Copie of the said Assesments of the respective Counties and Villages within the said Precincts.

dateline.hi: Dated at the Council-Chamber in Dublin

signed.hi: Thomas Herbert Clerk of the Council.

opener.byline: By his Highness the Lord Protector's Council for the Affairs of IRELAND.

div.p: ORdered, That this Declaration and Commission for the Assesments be forthwith Printed and Published.

closer.signed: Thomas Herbert Clerk of the Council.
